snippet: In the new food-for-nukes deal with North Korea, the U.S. government will ship a quarter-million tons of food aid to the North. Americans pay for it, sure, but does the food actually come from the United States? Or does it come from closer, cheaper...
abstract: In the new food-for-nukes deal with North Korea, the U.S. government will ship a quarter-million tons of food aid to the North. Americans pay for it, sure, but does the food actually come from the United States? Or does it come from closer, cheaper places like China? And who will make sure that the North Korean mafiosi don't make off with big chunks of it?

headline.main: Should U.S. Food Aid Be Made in China?
